decks.notes: This deck focuses on using lands as a resource to control the game, with key cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo for a quick win condition. It also utilizes cards like Crop Rotation, Exploration, and Life from the Loam to manipulate and reuse lands effectively. The deck is designed to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port while also providing longevity with cards like Glacial Chasm and Punishing Fire. Overall, the strategy revolves around controlling the board and outlasting the opponent until the win condition can be achieved.

The deck revolves around the Dark Depths combo, which involves sacrificing the Vampire Hexmage or using the Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also includes cards like Crop Rotation, Expedition Map, and Sylvan Scrying to tutor for the Dark Depths combo pieces. It also includes disruption cards like Duress, Thoughtseize, Pithing Needle, and Sylvan Safekeeper to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on aggressive play with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and True-Name Nemesis, supported by disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Deathrite Shaman and Young Pyromancer while using Lightning Bolt and Forked Bolt for additional removal. The deck also includes cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for key cards, along with disruption in the form of Wasteland and Spell Pierce. Overall, the deck prioritizes applying pressure early and maintaining control throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb, and then cheat out powerful creatures like Inferno Titan, Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, and Griselbrand using cards such as Sneak Attack and Through the Breach. The deck also aims to disrupt opponents by using Chalice of the Void, Blood Moon, and Blood Sun to control the board and limit their options. Overall, the focus is on fast mana acceleration and explosive plays to overwhelm opponents and win the game quickly.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's hand and board while utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Deathrite Shaman to pressure them. The deck aims to control the game with disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach, Force of Will, and Daze, while also maintaining card advantage and consistency through cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm. The inclusion of cards like Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay provide answers to threats on the board, and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Leovold, Emissary of Trest give additional value and control options.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using disruptive creatures and taxing effects, while pressuring them with aggressive creatures like Mirran Crusader and Serra Avenger. The deck also aims to control the board with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and equipment like Sword of Fire and Ice. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Mother of Runes and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to protect its own creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana denial strategy with cards like Rishadan Port and Wasteland helps to further hinder the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents' strategies with disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Sanctum Prelate, while also using cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port to disrupt the opponent's mana base. It also utilizes powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to quickly close out games. The deck has a solid aggro plan with creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Flickerwisp, while also having access to utility creatures like Recruiter of the Guard and Phyrexian Revoker to adapt to different matchups and situations.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a high amount of mana quickly through cards like Lion's Eye Diamond, Lotus Petal, and rituals, and then cast a powerful storm spell like Tendrils of Agony to deal lethal damage to the opponent in one turn. The deck also utilizes cantrips like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to sculpt the perfect hand and disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Cabal Therapy and Duress. It aims to win the game through explosive combo turns while controlling the game with disruption spells.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control cards, such as countermagic, removal spells, and hand disruption, to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix. Leovold, Emissary of Trest further punishes opponents for drawing cards, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card selection and powerful late game advantage. The mana base supports a variety of colors to cast the diverse spells in the deck. The goal is to control the game and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It aims to control the battlefield through taxing effects like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and disruptive creatures like Phyrexian Revoker. The deck also utilizes powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice to enhance its creatures. With cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Recruiter of the Guard to search for specific tools and Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play, the deck combines tempo advantage with a disruptive strategy to dominate the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. The deck utilizes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Rishadan Port to slow down the opponent's spells and mana development, while deploying threats like Stoneforge Mystic and Serra Avenger to keep the pressure on. This deck also includes disruptive creatures like Phyrexian Revoker and Palace Jailer to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the goal is to control the board and tempo of the game while quickly closing out the match with efficient threats.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on early game aggression and disruption, utilizing cheap and efficient spells like Ponder, Gitaxian Probe, Lightning Bolt, and Delver of Secrets. By combining aggressive creatures like Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, Gurmag Angler, and Deathrite Shaman with powerful disruption cards like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to control the board while dealing direct damage to the opponent. With a strong mana base and versatile card selection tools like Brainstorm, this deck seeks to maintain aggressive pressure while controlling the flow of the game.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly and efficiently use pump spells and protective cards to give evasion to creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf to deal lethal poison damage to the opponent. By using cards like Become Immense, Vines of Vastwood, and Mutagenic Growth, the deck can surprise the opponent with sudden bursts of damage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Spell Pierce and Spellskite to protect the combo pieces. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the infect combo and overwhelm the opponent before they can react.

The deck focuses on using efficient control cards to disrupt opponents' strategies while generating value through the graveyard with Life from the Loam and Punishing Fire. It also utilizes powerful creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Dark Confidant to apply pressure and grind out wins. The deck's mana base is carefully curated to provide consistent access to the colors needed for its spells, including utility lands like Wasteland and Karakas. Overall, it aims to outvalue opponents through card advantage and resource denial.

This Legacy Merfolk deck focuses on flooding the board with aggressively costed Merfolk creatures, leveraging lords like Lord of Atlantis, Master of the Pearl Trident, and Phantasmal Image to pump up the team. True-Name Nemesis provides protection and evasion, while disruption comes in the form of counterspells like Daze and Force of Will. Aether Vial allows for efficient creature deployment, while Chalice of the Void helps to stifle opposing strategies. The mana base is streamlined to support the tribal plan, with a focus on maximizing creature synergy and tempo advantage.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plans with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while also maintaining card advantage and tempo using cards like Brainstorm and True-Name Nemesis. It also aims to control the board with efficient removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Diabolic Edict, while providing additional value through cards like Baleful Strix. The deck aims to pressure the opponent's life total quickly with aggressive creatures like Leovold, Emissary of Trest and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, ultimately aiming to outvalue and outpace the opponent in the mid to late game.
